meanings.definition: Delay or block (a legislative action) by making prolonged speeches or using other tactics.
meanings.sent1: The senator filibustered the bill by talking for hours on end.
meanings.sent2: The opposition party filibustered the proposed law to prevent it from passing.
meanings.sent3: The politician filibustered the meeting with a never-ending speech, much to the annoyance of everyone present.
meanings.sent4: The student filibustered the teacher's instructions with a series of irrelevant questions.
meanings.sent5: The activist filibustered the construction project by staging a peaceful protest in front of the site.

meanings.sent1: During the debate, the politician filibustered by constantly interrupting the speaker.
meanings.sent2: The members of the parliament filibustered the discussion by bringing up unrelated topics.
meanings.sent3: The cat filibustered the dog's attempt to play by stealing its toy and running away.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds filibustered the sunny day, bringing unexpected rain showers.
meanings.sent5: The noisy construction work filibustered the peaceful atmosphere of the neighborhood.
